clinical_study.brief_title: Block REducing Pain After Surgery Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Observational Single-centre Study: Difference in the Incidence of Chronic Pain After Breast Surgery Between General Anesthesia and General Anesthesia Associated With PECS Block (Block REducing Pain After Surgery Trial)

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study evaluates difference in chronic pain after six months from surgery between patients who received PECS block and general anesthesia versus general anesthesia alone.

detailed_description.textblock:
PECS block is used as a pain relief technique during breast surgery. However at the actual state of knowledge there is no strong evidence that its use could lower incidence of chronic pain compared to general anesthesia alone.
Moreover for its use an adequate skill with ultrasound machine is required. For this reason only some anesthesiologists in our reality use this technique it in clinical practice.

primary_outcome.description: Presence of chronic pain at six months after surgery. For this purpouse patient will be asked to report presence of pain on breast, neck, axilla or arm. If patient will report pain a further question about intensity (NRS) and quality (we will ask to patient to describe with words from one to three the pain). Furtermore we will ask to patient if he had take any action (eg drugs) to treat pain

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of chronic pain at three months after surgery. For this purpouse patient will be asked to report presence of pain on breast, neck, axilla or arm. If patient will report pain a further question about intensity (NRS) and quality (we will ask to patient to describe with words from one to three the pain). Furtermore we will ask to patient if he had take any action (eg drugs) to treat pain

Presence of chronic pain at nine months after surgery. For this purpouse patient will be asked to report presence of pain on breast, neck, axilla or arm. If patient will report pain a further question about intensity (NRS) and quality (we will ask to patient to describe with words from one to three the pain). Furtermore we will ask to patient if he had take any action (eg drugs) to treat pain

Presence of chronic pain at twelve months after surgery. For this purpouse patient will be asked to report presence of pain on breast, neck, axilla or arm. If patient will report pain a further question about intensity (NRS) and quality (we will ask to patient to describe with words from one to three the pain). Furtermore we will ask to patient if he had take any action (eg drugs) to treat pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in opioid consumption during surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in opioid consumpion during surgery (Fentanyl as mcg/kg/h; Remifentanil as mcg/kg/min)

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in pain in the first 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: maximum and mean NRS score in the first 24 hours after surgery

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing mastectomy, partial mastectomy and/or axillary clearance who received PECS block AND general anesthesia for the surgery.
Patients undergoing mastectomy, partial mastectomy and/or axillary clearance who received general anesthesia only for the surgery.

intervention.description: It consists in injection of 20-30 ml of local anesthetic between pectoral minor, pectoral major, and serratus muscles.

study_pop.textblock: Patients needing breast surgery (mastectomy, partial mastectomy and/or axillary clearence)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- programmed breast surgery
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- bilateral breast surgery
